properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to attend the Fairfield Spring Fest held on Harris and William Streets from 12pm to 8pm on Saturday and Sunday.

From 7pm Friday 23 September, sections of William Street, Harris Street and Downey Lane will be closed until 5am Monday 26 September. Motorists will be detoured via local roads.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads approaching and within Fairfield while the event is underway. Motorists are advised to allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

arrangementElements.html:
FAIRFIELD

7PM FRIDAY 23 SEPTEMBER TO 5AM MONDAY 26 SEPTEMBER

  • William St between Harris St and Hamilton Rd
  • Harris St between Barbara St and Ware St
  • Southern end of Downey Lane (near Harris St)

NOTE: There will be limited access for residents, businesses and service vehicles to the abovementioned closures between 7pm Friday 23 September and midnight Saturday 24 September, and between midnight and 5am Monday 26 September.
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

webLinks.linkText: UCI Road World Championships 2022 - road closures

properties.publicTransport: Major bus diversions will be in effect while road closures are in place for the duration of the event. Visit transportnsw.info for more details and to plan your trip on public transport
properties.otherAdvice:
The UCI Road World Championships will be hosted in Wollongong, with eight days of competitive cycle racing from 18 to 25 September and a training day on Saturday 17 September.

Major road closures and extensive special event clearways will be in effect for the duration of the event at various times.

The M1 Princes Mwy, Memorial Dr and the Princes Hwy (except for a section in Fairy Meadow) will remain open throughout the event.

There will be closures on Lawrence Hargrave Dr, Masters Rd, Springhill Rd, Five Islands Rd and the Princes Hwy at Unanderra on Saturday 24 and Sunday 25 September only.

Towradgi Rd and Balgownie Rd will also remain open and provide a connection to the suburbs of Mt Ousley, Fairy Meadow, Towradgi and Balgownie.

Road closures for each day are displayed in the interactive maps below

  • Training - Saturday 17 September - closures from 7.30am to 12pm/5pm
  • Day 1 – Sunday 18 September - closures from 8am to 6pm
  • Day 2 – Monday 19 September - closures from 11.30am to 6pm
  • Day 3 – Tuesday 20 September - closures from 8am to 6pm
  • Day 4 – Wednesday 21 September - closures from 12.30pm to 6pm
  • Day 5 – Thursday 22 September - closures from 8am to 1.30pm
  • Day 6 – Friday 23 September - closures from 7am to 6pm
  • Day 7 – Saturday 24 September - closures between 6.45am and 3.30pm
  • Day 8 – Sunday 25 September - closures between 8.45am and 6pm

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on various roads along and surrounding the event courses through Wollongong and surrounding suburbs between Thursday 15 September and Sunday 25 September.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even for local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

roads.mainStreet: Princes Highway, Corrimal Street, Squires Way, Pioneer Drive

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in tickets to the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
AFL Preliminary Final: Sydney Swans v TBC at Sydney Cricket Ground. Gates open 2.45pm, first bounce 4.45pm, final whistle 7.25pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 1:45pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP2 Kippax car park from Moore Park Rd, from the Eastern Distributor use the Bondi exit. Access EP3 southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd, from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. Car parks open from 1.45pm.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 1pm until 9pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Chalmers St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.otherAdvice:
Billie Eilish concerts at Qudos Bank Arena Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday evening. Doors open nightly at 6:30pm, main act starts from 9pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
George Main Stakes Race Day - The Everest Carnival at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race from 11:40am, last race at 5:15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as event goers travel to and from the races. Traffic will also be heavier than usual around the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads around the racecourse at the following times and locations:

  • 6am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side)
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

RANDWICK

  • 6am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side)
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side)

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.otherAdvice:
NRLW Triple Header. Entry via eastern gates only, open from 11:45am. Finish at approx 5:55pm.

  • Broncos v Eels Kick-Off from 12:05pm
  • Titans v Roosters Kick-Off from 1:55pm
  • Dragons v Knights Kick-Off from 3:55pm

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will be closed from 10:45am between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St and will reopen after all events are finished.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 2,500 particpants are expected to take part in this year's Bobbin Head Cycle Classic. Events start and finish at Karuah Oval in Turramurra, from 6am. All events will finish by 1:30pm. Changed traffic conditions will be in effect along the course for the safety of participants.

Road and lane closures will be in place along the course at various locations and times between 5am and 3pm, including on sections of Karuah Rd, Turramurra Ave, Bobbin Head Rd, Warrimoo Ave, Woodbury Rd, General San Martin Dr, Old Pacific Hwy and Mona Vale Rd through Turramurra, Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park, Mt Colah, St Ives and Terry Hills. 

Speed limit reductions will be in effect at key locations at various times between 6am and 2pm.

A special event clearway will also be in place on the eastern side of a section of Mona Vale Rd in St Ives from 7am until 1:30pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully for the most up-to-date information as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location. Note: this information is correct at time of publication but may change at late notice, always check signage for the most up-to-date information.

arrangementElements.html:

FROM 8:30AM TO 1:30PM

  • Woodbury Road between Mona Vale Road and Hume Avenue (eastbound)

properties.otherAdvice:
More than 35,000 people are expected to participate in one of four courses of Sydney’s most iconic running event, Sydney Running Festival, on Sunday 18 September. Significant road closures will be in place in the Sydney CBD, Milsons Point, Darlinghurst, Pyrmont and Moore Park between 4am and 1.30pm.

Major roads will close from 4am including the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Western Distributor between Pyrmont and the City. There will be no direct access between the Harbour Bridge and Anzac Bridge until after midday. The Sydney Harbour Tunnel will remain open in both directions however long delays are expected so motorists should consider the Victoria Rd and Gladesville Bridge alternative route to travel to and from the city instead.

Key road closures:

  • 4am to 11am – Sydney Harbour Bridge: full closure of the Harbour Bridge including the Cahill Expressway and all on-ramps. All traffic will be diverted via the Harbour Tunnel in both directions. The Harbour Bridge walkway and cycleway will remain open.
  • 4am to 11am - Milsons Point and Darlinghurst: Alfred St South, Lavender St, Middlemiss St, Broughton St, Olympic Dr, Oxford St and Flinders St will be closed.
  • 4am to 11.30am – Sydney CBD and Circular Quay: sections of George St, Bridge St, College St, Macquarie St, Hunter St, Phillip St and Young St will be closed. Macquarie St north of Bridge St remains closed until 12pm.
  • 4am to 12pm – Barangaroo and Western Distributor Pyrmont to CBD: the Western Distributor will be closed between Pyrmont and the city including all on and off-ramps. All citybound traffic on the Anzac Bridge will be diverted via the Bathurst St off-ramp. No direct access between the Anzac Bridge and Sydney Harbour Bridge until 12pm. The Pyrmont St on-ramp will remain closed until 12:30pm. Sections of Sussex St and roads in Barangaroo will also close.
  • 4am to 12.30pm – Pyrmont: Pirrama Rd, Murray St, Bowman St, Union St and surrounding local roads will close. The northern end of Pirrama Rd and roads in Darling Island will be closed from 1am.
  • 4am to 1.30pm – The Rocks, Walsh Bay and Millers Point: Hickson Rd from George St to Barton St and Circular Quay West will be closed.
  • 5:30am to 11am – Moore Park: Lang Rd, Moore Park Rd and sections of South Dowling St. No access to the Entertainment Quarter via Anzac Pde, access via Oxford St only. Eastern Distributor Bondi exit will be closed 7am to 9am. Centennial Park will be closed to all vehicles and cyclists from 4am to 11am.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on major roads along and surrounding the course from 1am in Milsons Point, the city and Pyrmont and from 4am in Darlinghurst and Moore Park. All clearways will be lifted by 1.30pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to residents with local council parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully on the day and the night before as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest available legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.html:
Kirribilli / Lavender Bay / Milsons Point / North Sydney

From 4am to 10am

  • Alfred St South between Olympic Dr and Paul St
  • Arthur St between Middlemiss St and Pacific Hwy
  • Bligh St between Humphrey Pl and Broughton St
  • Broughton St between Burton St and Olympic Dr

  • Lavender St between Cliff St and Alfred St South

Notes:

*1 Lavender St remains open westbound. Residents can exit from properties west of Alfred St South via Cliff St or Harbourview Cres to Lavender St westbound. Paul St, Dind St, Glen St and Cliff St closed at Alfred St South. Residents can exit from these roads only. No entry between 4am and 10am.

 

From 4am to 11am

  • Alfred St South between Paul St and Lavender St
  • Burton St between Alfred St South and Broughton St
  • Fitzroy St between Alfred St South and Broughton St

Sydney Harbour Bridge and Approaches

From 4am to 11am

  • Bradfield Hwy / Sydney Harbour Bridge*2 all northbound and southbound lanes
  • Cahill Expressway between Sydney Harbour Bridge and The Domain Tunnel
  • Pacific Hwy between Bradfield Hwy and High St northbound
  • Warringah Freeway all access ramps and lanes to and from the Sydney Harbour Bridge
  • Western Distributor*3 all access ramps and lanes to and from the Sydney Harbour Bridge
  • Harbour St between Bathurst St and The Western Distributor southbound

Notes:

*2 The Sydney Harbour Tunnel will remain open in both directions during the event except for use by oversize vehicles or vehicles carrying dangerous goods. These vehicles will be detoured via the Gladesville Bridge and ANZAC Bridge when the Sydney Harbour Bridge is closed.

*3 The Anzac Bridge will remain open in both directions during the event with the Western Distributor / Bathurst St exit ramp available to provide access to the Sydney CBD and the Cross City Tunnel. Following the opening of the Sydney Harbour Bridge at 11am, the Bathurst St exit ramp from the Western Distributor can also be used to access the Sydney Harbour Bridge via Bathurst St & Kent St.

 

Western Distributor

From 4am to 12pm midday

  • Harbour St between Day St and The Western Distributor northbound
  • Western Distributor King St/Harbour Bridge Off Ramp northbound
  • Western Distributor Fig St on Ramp eastbound

Western Distributor

From 4am to 12:30pm

Barangaroo / Centennial Park / Darlinghurst / Dawes Point / Millers Point / Moore Park / Paddington / The Rocks / Surry Hills / Sydney CBD

From 4am to 11am

Notes:

*4 Centennial Park is closed to all traffic whilst runners are in the Parklands

*5 During the closure of Flinders St, access from Albion St to South Dowling St will be maintained along Flinders St under the direction of traffic controllers.

*6 Between 8am and 10am access to Hospital Rd will be via two way contra flow at Shakespeare Pl. At all other times access to Hospital Rd will be via traffic control at St Marys Rd.

 

From 4am to 11:30am

Notes:

*7 Local access from Albert St, Loftus Ln, Phillip Ln, the Intercontinental Hotel, the Sir Stamford Hotel and Quay Grand Suites will be via traffic control at Bridge St and Phillip St. There will be limited access during the road closures and no access from 6am to 7:15am and between 7:45am to 10:30am. Directions to vehicles will be via Police & traffic controllers in the area.

*8 Shakespeare Pl remains a crossover point for eastbound and westbound traffic until 6am.

*10 During the Harbour Bridge closure from 4am to 11am, access to Wheat Rd for Cockle Bay Wharf tenants, residents and deliveries will be via traffic control on Harbour St at Day St. Exiting the area will be via two way traffic control on Wheat Rd between 6:15am and 10:30am. From 10:30am vehicles exiting the area will be via Erskine Street under the direction of NSW Police

*14 Access to Barangaroo car park at the intersection of Dalgety Rd and Towns Pl maintained. Access to Towns Pl car park at the intersection of Towns Pl and Hickson Rd maintained via contra flow.

 

From 5:30am to 11am

*16 Access to Driver Ave will reopen at 10:30am.

*17 Access to Entertainment Quarter is via Oxford St, Oatley Rd, Moore Park Rd eastbound and Cook Rd if Lang Rd is closed at Oxford St southbound due to congestion on Lang Rd.

 

From 7am to 9am

 Notes:

*18 The Eastern Distributor off ramp to Anzac Parade (southbound) will remain open at all times during the event.

 

From 7:30am to 10am

  • Dibbs St*19 Between Robertson Road and Martin Road 
  • Martin Rd*19 between Robertson Road (northern) and Robertson Road (southern)
  • Oxley Ln*19 between Robertson Road (northern) and Robertson Road (southern)

 Notes:

*19 Robertson Rd at Lang Rd will be a managed crossing point during the event and will be fully closed between 7:30am and 10am while the bulk of runners cross Robertson Rd.

 Notes:

*22 Resident access maintained from 1am to 6:30am under directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police. There will be no resident access from 6:30am to 12:30pm.

*22 Resident access maintained from 4am to 6:30am under directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police. There will be no resident access from 6:30am to 12:30pm.

*23 Access to The Star Taxi & Hire Car plaza maintained.

*24 Resident access to driveways on western side of Pyrmont St maintained during the event under the direction of Traffic Controllers.

 

Cycleway Closures

Cycleway closures affect both directions unless stated otherwise. Cycleways will be progressively re-opened by TfNSW and Police after cleaning.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents, businesses or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. Check signs carefully on the day and the night before as clearways come into effect in the early morning. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location. Special Event Clearways affect both directions unless stated otherwise.

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.suburb: Milsons Point, Sydney CBD, Moore Park, Darlinghurst and Pyrmont

properties.otherAdvice:
AFLW: Sydney Swans v GWS Giants at the SCG. First bounce from 2:40pm and full-time around 4:20pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 12:30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access the Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. If you're travelling via the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. Please note, EP2 and EP3 grass car parks will not open for this game.

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.otherAdvice:
Run to Rose Race Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 11:40am, last race at 5:15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

Valleyways Festival at Onslow Oval. Start at 11:30am, finish approx. 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Onslow Oval as festival-goers travel to and from the event.

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include return travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Finals Week 1: Sharks v Cowboys at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Kick-off from 7:50pm and full-time around 9:50pm.

Road closures will be in place on Captain Cook Drive from approximately 10 minutes before kick off and 30 minutes after full time.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium may be heavier than usual including Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in tickets to the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park Game Day Clearway Map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: Moore Park Game Day Clearway Map.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park Game Day Clearway Map

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Elimination Final: Roosters v Rabbitohs at Allianz Stadium. NRLW kick-off at 1:10pm. NRL kick-off from 4:05pm and full-time around 6:05pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 11:45am and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP3 southern grass car park (open from 12:30pm) or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. Use the Randwick exit from the Eastern Distributor. Please note, the EP2 Kippax car park will not open for this match. Royal Randwick Racecourse car park will also be open for NRL fans on Sunday, entry via Ascot St - connect with light rail services from Randwick or Kensington stops to Moore Park. 

The Eastern Distributor Bondi exit to Moore Park Rd will close from 5:45pm to 7:15pm for the safety of pedestrians leaving the stadium. Use the Randwick exit during this time for access to Moore Park.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 12pm until 8pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Chalmers St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.publicTransport: Additional buses are running between the city, Bondi Junction and Bondi Beach. Services will be busy. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Festival of the Winds 2022 road closure and clearway map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: Festival of the Winds 2022 road closure and clearway map.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Festival of the Winds 2022 road closure and clearway map
arrangementAttachments.uniqueFileName: 628497_1661839915461_Festival of the Winds 2022 road closure and clearway map.pdf

properties.otherAdvice:
Over 40,000 people are expected to attend the annual Festival of the Winds at Bondi Beach from 11am to 4pm.

Traffic will be very heavy on approaches to Bondi including Bondi Rd, Syd Einfeld Dr, Old South Head Rd and Military Rd as well as local roads around Bondi Beach. Motorists are advised to avoid non-essential travel or allow plenty of extra travel time.

Special event clearways are in effect from 7am to 7pm on both sides of Bondi Rd between Old South Head Rd and Sandridge St and sections of Campbell Pde, Hall St and Curlewis St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a towing fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

Roads around Bondi Junction Interchange are closed from 10am to 6pm including sections of Grafton St, Grosvenor St, Oxford St and Grosvenor Lane. 

Access to the Queen Elizabeth Dr and Park Dr carparks is being managed under traffic control from 5am to 7pm.

arrangementElements.html:
BONDI JUNCTION – FROM 10AM TO 6PM

  • Grafton Street between Grosvenor Street and Newland Street (westbound)
  • Grosvenor Street between Spring Street and Grafton Street (both directions)
  • Oxford Street between Adelaide Street and Grosvenor Street (both directions)
  • Grosvenor Lane between Newland Street and Grosvenor Street* (eastbound)

*Resident access permitted.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Proclamation Ceremony - road closure map Sun 11 Sep 2022
arrangementAttachments.fileName: Proclamation Ceremony - road closure map Sun 11 Sep 2022.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Proclamation Ceremony - road closure map Sun 11 Sep 2022
arrangementAttachments.uniqueFileName: 983876_1662715204189_Proclamation Ceremony - road closure map Sun 11 Sep 2022.pdf

properties.otherAdvice:
Closures will be in place on Macquarie St for a Proclamation Ceremony to be held at NSW Parliament House.

  • From 9am to 3pm - both directions of Macquarie St between Bent St and St James Rd will be closed. Sections of Hunter St between Macquarie St and Phillip St will be closed. Lane 1 on Shakespeare Pl between Hospital Rd and Macquarie St will also be closed.
  • From 3pm to 6pm - northbound lanes of Macquarie St from St James Rd to Bent St will be closed.

Motorists will be detoured via St James Rd/Bent St and Elizabeth St. Allow extra travel time as delays are expected on surrounding roads while closures are in place.

The northbound parking lane on Macquarie St from St James Rd to Bent St will be closed overnight from 6pm on Saturday. Strict no-parking restrictions will be in effect until Macquarie St reopens at 6pm on Sunday.
